page.title: 11TWEED PRODUCTION IN BACK
page.content: {HARRIS TWEED} is the basis of economic existance on the island.A large percentage of the working people are in this industry.The wool from the sheep is washed,rinsed and dried.Dyes are added.The processed wool from the factory is distributed by lorry to the weaver's own home where it is woven on a loom.The weaver is self-employed. When the tweed is complete it is collected by a lorry and taken back to the factory where it is washed,mended and{THE ORB-MARK}is applied.It is then ready for exporting and to be made into clothing. Much of the tweed is exported to the USA, Japan and Europe.
